name: Move for Sight
description:
Join us for an inclusive, family-friendly event that unites the vision loss community to raise awareness and critical funds for vision research, treatments, and education. 

Enjoy a morning packed with fun activities for all ages, live music, delicious food, and exciting entertainment. Then, gather with family, friends, and colleagues for a meaningful walk that will get us all moving for a brighter future.

name: 2nd Annual Jane and Finch Pride Ball: Celebrating Our Roots
description:
A full-day celebration uplifting the 2SLGBTQIA+ community in Jane and Finch through arts, culture, and community engagement. Highlights include a Pride Ball competition, live performances, interactive installations, a cultural heritage corner, youth empowerment workshop, and a community potluck. 

A City of Toronto Cultural Hotspot Signature Project.

name: Black Comedy Night - a Stand-Up Comedy Show
description: After an electric first success, Black Comedy Night is back with an all-new lineup of Canada's best comedians New faces, new jokes, same unmatched energy. Featuring Tobi Solebo, Clif Knight, Kerby Darius, and Daphney Joseph. The first show sold out. This one goes even harder. Saturday Night. Two Shows. Twice the Energy.

name: Visualizing the Junction Triangle - Our Corner of the World
description:
This is a unique joint offering of a historical walking tour and subsequent museum tour. Set within MOCA's home neighbourhood - the Junction Triangle - the tour begins where art meets history, exploring the fascinating legacies of the neighbourhood's churches, bridges, "death-traps", and even a famous boxer.

Following the tour of the neighbourhood is a guided tour of MOCA's current exhibition, "Shoes, books, hands, buildings, and cars", by Margaux Williamson. 

Attendees will also have the opportunity to learn more about MOCA's own history and placement within a heritage building.

Distance: Approximately 2 kilometres

name: Come Play Werewolf
description:
Good at bluffing? Prove it!

Calling all game enthusiasts in Toronto! Join in for a fun-filled time where we will be playing the social deduction game Werewolf. Whether you're a seasoned player or a newbie, this event is perfect for anyone looking to be social while sharpening their strategic thinking skills. 

Please remember kindness, respect, and safety for all. See website below for mailing list and more information.

name: Theo x Travis: Jazz is Dead
description:
What happens when a Grammy-nominated jazz artist and a multiple award-winning tap dance powerhouse unite for an electrifying exchange on the "death" of jazz? 

Trumpeter Theo Croker and tap dancer Travis Knights take musical performance to the next level in this dynamic union of sound and movement. Fusing jazz, hip-hop, R&B, and live improvisation, this show brings a fresh edge to the timeless art form of jazz—bold, electric, and completely unpredictable.

A world premiere, conceived by Timea Wharton-Suri and co-commissioned by dance Immersion and Luminato Festival, Jazz is Dead isn't a tribute—it's a rebirth

name: Community Environment Day at Glen Long Community Centre
description:
Join Councillor Colle (Ward 8) and the City of Toronto to help reduce the amount of waste going to landfill. Drop off household items for donation, electronics for reuse or recycling and household hazardous waste for proper disposal. 

Pick up free bagged compost while supplies last and kitchen catchers for organics ($7 each – cash, debit and credit accepted).

name: Theo x Travis: Jazz is Dead

location.name: Meridian Arts Centre, The Studio Theatre

description:
What happens when a Grammy-nominated jazz artist and a tap dance powerhouse unite for an electrifying exchange on the "death" of jazz? Trumpeter Theo Croker and tap dancer Travis Knights push musical boundaries in a dynamic fusion of jazz, hip-hop, R&B, and live improvisation. Their electric synergy creates a bold, unpredictable performance that reimagines a timeless art form.

Jazz is Dead isn't a tribute—it's a rebirth.
